raw.title: [BIP-741] Grant V3 Permissions to Maxis and Emergency DAO Multisigs
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
As per [BIP-734](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-734-balancer-v3-launch-and-protocol-enhancements/6168), Balancer V3 contracts have successfully been deployed to Ethereum and Gnosis! In order to both (1) call emergency functions (2) manage pool settings, it is proposed that the following existing multisigs are granted the following roles by the authorizer:

## Emergency DAO

- `VaultAdmin.pauseVault`
- `VaultAdmin.unpauseVault`
- `VaultAdmin.pausePool`
- `VaultAdmin.unpausePool`
- `VaultAdmin.pauseVaultBuffers`
- `VaultAdmin.unpauseVaultBuffers`
- `VaultAdmin.enableRecoveryMode`
- `VaultAdmin.disableRecoveryMode`
- `VaultAdmin.enableQuery`
- `VaultAdmin.disableQuery`
- `VaultAdmin.disableQueryPermanently`
- `StablePoolFactory.disable`
- `WeightedPoolFactory.disable`

## Maxis

- `VaultAdmin.setStaticSwapFeePercentage`
- `StablePool.startAmplificationParameterUpdate`
- `StablePool.stopAmplificationParameterUpdate`
- `ProtocolFeeController.setGlobalProtocolSwapFeePercentage`
- `ProtocolFeeController.setGlobalProtocolYieldFeePercentage`
- `ProtocolFeeController.setProtocolSwapFeePercentage`
- `ProtocolFeeController.setProtocolYieldFeePercentage`
- `ProtocolFeeController.withdrawProtocolFees`
- `ProtocolFeeController.withdrawProtocolFeesForToken`

# Payload

The required payload can be found [on our GitHub repo](https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1535) and can be summarised as follows:

cleaned.title: [BIP-749] Grant `add_reward` Permissions to Maxis’ Omnichain Multisig
cleaned.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516

raw.title: [BIP-749] Grant `add_reward` Permissions to Maxis’ Omnichain Multisig
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
# PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1612

# Motivation

The action of whitelisting a custom reward token on a gauge is permissioned. Doing it through the DAO multisig for every partner/gauge/token is not feasible, hence [BIP-387](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-387-give-balancer-maxis-ability-to-add-3rd-party-rewards-to-mainnet-gauges/5018) requested permission for calling `add_reward` through the authorizer from the Maxis’ multisig.

The Maxis are however in the process of migrating their multisig to the so-called omnichain multisig, a multisig that has the same address on all chains. Over time it will replace the old one. In a lot of cases it already has replaced it; this permission is one of the last things that keeps the Maxis from moving over fully.

# Specification

On Ethereum, the DAO multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will call `grantRole(bytes32,address)` on the authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` with the following arguments:

* role: `0x3bf29175652a3f0fac5abb715d0b7fe2e7b597e2e2eff555dac6b21a20a7c83e` ([ref](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L714C41-L714C107))
* account: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e` ([ref](https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/bal_addresses/blob/78e701eeca6d376b43a80684b5cfec50df0a971a/extras/multisigs.json#L11C19-L11C61))

It will perform the same action on all other chains where the omnichain multisig is deployed and does not have these permissions yet: Arbitrum, Avalanche, Base, Gnosis, Optimism and Polygon.

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-500] Root gauges bridge settings
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/672

Arbitrum and Optimism root gauges contain internal settings related to the cost of bridging BAL incentives minted on Mainnet to the corresponding liquidity gauges on Arbitrum/Optimism.

This proposal aims to grant to Balancer Maxis the role to manage those settings, so as to be able to tune them according to network conditions.

# Specification

From the Balancer DAO Governance Multisig (`0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f`):

* Call `grantRoles` on the `Authorizer` (`0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6`) with:
  * roles: `[0xd5799f5a62cdbcebada0c4ff21f7a0d82cfc1ad293c79f597c27bd1c03ad100b, 0x6a625c2e350a93dad2713c2fa449ec9304288897f8b7ad89c21417b9020eb99e]` ([source](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L751), [source](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L760))
  * account: `0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860`

choices: No, this is not the way

cleaned.title: [BIP-369] Grant CSPv5 Swap Fee Permissions to Cowswap & 1inch Labs Solver
cleaned.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e

raw.title: [BIP-369] Grant CSPv5 Swap Fee Permissions to Cowswap & 1inch Labs Solver
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payloads
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/382

### Motivation 

To continue the experiment started in BIP-295 and BIP-334 this will grant the role for calling `setSwapFeePercentage` on the recently released composable stable pool factory v5 to the GPv2 Settlement contract (cowswap) and the 1inch Labs Solver.

### Specification

#### Ethereum
If approved, the DAO Multisig `eth:0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call `grantRole` twice with the following arguments:

Role: `0x42bc3b76ebdb675c6f7836b464d27c7517e14b05dc08bb944a4837563fc805ca`

Account: `0xad3b67bca8935cb510c8d18bd45f0b94f54a968f`

Which corresponds to the address for 1inch Labs’ Fusion resolver.

Role: `0x42bc3b76ebdb675c6f7836b464d27c7517e14b05dc08bb944a4837563fc805ca`

Account: `0x9008D19f58AAbD9eD0D60971565AA8510560ab41`

Which corresponds to the address for Cowswap’s `GPv2Settlement` contract 


#### Polygon
If approved, the DAO Multisig `matic:0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call `grantRole` with the following arguments:

Role: `0x8e9ee99533bd178c1573e352145db0eeb33e8722b92d1d6fbc1de799b41f180c`

Account: `0xad3b67bca8935cb510c8d18bd45f0b94f54a968f`

Which corresponds to the address for 1inch Labs’ Fusion resolver.

#### Arbitrum

If approved, the DAO Multisig `arb1:0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call `grantRole` with the following arguments:

Role: `0xfab324385696857b52130b135e7e81f8b7f34382c9b27f254b6bca9a70fe0784`

Account: `0xad3b67bca8935cb510c8d18bd45f0b94f54a968f`

Which corresponds to the address for 1inch Labs’ Fusion resolver.

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: The proposal aims to grant V3 permissions to Maxis and Emergency DAO multisigs on Arbitrum One and Base, replicating prior permissions granted on Ethereum mainnet. Timeline analytics show unanimous early and consistent support. Forum sentiment is mostly neutral to positive, with no opposition expressed. Historical adjacent proposals with similar permissions changes were successful despite minor post-vote price declines, reflecting durable organizational benefit.
key_arguments_for: Permissions grant is essential for safe and successful Layer 2 deployments on Arbitrum One and Base.
All timeline quartiles show unanimous support with stable vote progression.
Forum sentiment supports the proposal, emphasizing safety and operational readiness.
Similar past proposals were approved and helped expand protocol capabilities without detrimental impact.

evidence.quote: User ZenDragon supports the permissions for safe and successful L2 deployments.
All votes (5) supported option 'Yes, let's do it' with 100% lead ratio and stability.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.simulation_reason: Recommendation based on timeline metrics, forum sentiment, and adjacent historical proposals, independent of final tally.
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Unanimous and stable vote support across all timeline quartiles indicates strong community consensus.
- Forum sentiment is supportive or neutral with no negative comments, aligning well with the recommendation.
- Similar past proposals granting multisig permissions for new chains were accepted and facilitated protocol expansion, offering positive precedent.
- Despite post-vote market declines, those do not outweigh the operational necessity and security benefits from granting these permissions.
- The recommendation mirrors aggregated forum sentiment, reflecting community views effectively.
